name: rgallery
description: The offline photo/video timeline that syncs from your filesystem.
readme_summary: rgallery is an offline photo and video timeline application that syncs from your filesystem. It provides a web interface with features like timeline view, search, map view, EXIF metadata display, and folder browsing, aiming to unify photo and video collections into a single, elegant experience.
primary_use_case: Organizing and browsing personal photo and video collections.
cover_image_prompt: A librarian meticulously organizing memories in a vast, glowing digital library. The librarian uses a special lens to scan physical photos and videos, which then seamlessly integrate into a dynamic timeline projected onto the library's walls. The timeline is interactive, allowing the librarian to easily search, filter, and explore moments. Small screens display EXIF data and map locations associated with each memory. The library is bathed in soft, warm light, creating a nostalgic and inviting atmosphere. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: vex-tui
description: A beautiful, fast, and feature-rich terminal-based Excel and CSV viewer built with Go.
readme_summary: Vex-TUI is a terminal-based Excel and CSV viewer written in Go. It provides a feature-rich interface for viewing, navigating, and manipulating data within spreadsheet files directly from the command line, including support for multiple themes, data operations like copy/export, and live data visualization.
key_features: Powerful Navigation (Vim-style keybindings, jump to cell, search)
Data Operations (copy, export to CSV/JSON, toggle formula display)
Live Data Visualization (bar charts, line charts, sparklines, pie charts)
File Support (Excel, CSV, multiple sheets, formula display, lazy loading)
primary_use_case: Viewing and manipulating Excel and CSV files in a terminal environment.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled librarian stands amidst towering shelves filled with glowing spreadsheets instead of books. The librarian uses a pair of spectacles to examine a complex spreadsheet projected onto a floating screen, transforming rows and columns into interactive charts and graphs with a wave of their hand. Small UI elements displaying spreadsheet data and code snippets subtly float around the scene. The setting is a futuristic library with soft, ambient lighting. The composition is wide and detailed with a focus on the librarian and the projected spreadsheet. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors.

name: Seelen-UI
description: The Fully Customizable Desktop Environment for Windows 10/11.
readme_summary: Seelen UI is a customizable desktop environment for Windows 10/11, written in Rust. It aims to enhance user experience by providing tools for personalization, productivity, and seamless integration of various functionalities like a tiling window manager, media module, and app launcher.
key_features: Tiling Window Manager for enhanced multitasking
Integrated media module compatible with most music players
App launcher inspired by Rofi for quick application access
primary_use_case: Enhancing and personalizing the Windows desktop experience with a focus on customization and productivity.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled artisan meticulously crafting a stained-glass window, each pane representing a different aspect of the Windows desktop. The artisan carefully arranges panes representing widgets, icons, and themes, fitting them together to create a harmonious and personalized design. A stream of digital light flows through the window, illuminating a clean and organized workspace. Subtle UI elements are etched into the glass, hinting at the software's customization options. The scene is set in a bright, modern workshop with a focus on detail and precision. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and clear outlines.

name: tilelang
description: Domain-specific language designed to streamline the development of high-performance GPU/CPU/Accelerators kernels
readme_summary: Tile Language (tile-lang) is a domain-specific language designed to streamline the development of high-performance GPU/CPU kernels. It uses a Pythonic syntax and builds upon the TVM compiler infrastructure, allowing developers to focus on productivity while achieving state-of-the-art performance in areas like GEMM, Dequant GEMM, and FlashAttention.
key_features: AscendC and Ascend NPU IR backends
primary_use_case: Streamlining the development of high-performance GPU/CPU kernels for AI workloads.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled artisan meticulously crafting a high-performance engine from individual tiles, each representing a specific computational task. The engine is glowing with energy, showcasing its power and efficiency. The artisan uses a Pythonic-style blueprint and a TVM toolkit. Subtle UI elements display code snippets and performance metrics. The scene is set in a futuristic workshop with advanced tools and holographic displays. Digital particles flow around the engine, visualizing data processing. The composition is clean and focused, with a vibrant color scheme. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.
